intro: Micropholis obscura, commonly known as the dark micropholis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its small, dark-colored leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, where it thrives in the humid, shaded understory. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several small, hard seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Micropholis obscura is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
